availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William M. Simpson (Kentucky soldier. Quarter Master 11th Kentucky)

body.p: Kentucky soldier. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private, lieutenant, and quartermaster from September 22, 1862 to May 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Arkansas, Benton County, Round Prairie, p. 305C.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0111.
National Homes for Disabled Volunteer Soldiers, 1866-1938, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series M1749, p. 15655.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 276-7.
"Soldiers Home," The Leavenworth Times (Leavenworth, KS), April 13, 1913, p. 3.
